summary: ( GAO-21-481 )وصلة للنسخة باللغة العربية Since 1993, the U.S. government has provided more than $6.3 billion in bilateral assistance to Palestinians in the West Bank and Gaza. This aid ceased as of Jan. 2019, but the Biden administration has announced its intent to resume funding. For FYs 2015-19 assistance spending, the U.S. Agency for International Development ensured that the awards it funded directly went...
title: West Bank and Gaza Aid: Should Funding Resume, Increased Oversight of Subawardee Compliance with USAID's Antiterrorism Policies and Procedures May Reduce Risks
